name: State_8

timeline_beats.label: Integration into regional leagues and river trade networks
Participation in the Great Naval War
Pirate Suppression Campaign operations along outer shoals

factions.label: Harbor Guild
factions.influence_hint: Controls docks, shipping licenses, major port revenues

factions.label: Maritime Nobility
factions.influence_hint: Landed elites; naval levies and coastal fort command

factions.label: Tide-Circle Priests
factions.influence_hint: Ritual navigational auguries, local ritual authority

factions.label: Harbor Artisans & Alchemists
factions.influence_hint: Shipbuilding, ritual reagent processing, export guild

factions.label: Smaller Coastal Houses
factions.influence_hint: Local magistracies; swing votes between Guild and Nobility

traits: patronage through ship-naming and voyage oaths
guild apprenticeship central to social mobility
widespread pragmatic ritualism tied to seamanship

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics permitted.
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned within state jurisdiction.
Navigational auguries may assist but cannot replace charts, seamanship, or legal piloting requirements.
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents; logistics of import are a limiting factor.
Combustion-derived industry limited; no high-pressure steam megatechs available.
notes: Major ports (Emberharbor, Rivergate) are strategic choke points; control affects trade income and reagent import.
Seasonal storm window restricts large convoy movement; military operations often timed to it.
Harbor Guild issues docking licenses that effectively regulate private navies and merchant convoys.
Outer Shoals remain a persistent piracy pressure point despite W3; local knowledge and pilots remain essential.
Ritual reagent supply is politically sensitive; allied trade routes under A2 influence key imports.
